page.title: 05HOME LIFE & LANGUAGE
page.content: Some families have lived generation upon generation in the same area,and for many children tracing their ancestral roots is a simple exercise. It is not unusual for pupils to share their lessons with their relatives(in fact a couple of pupils in the secondary school are related to a teacher) and for many it is accepted that they will,as a matter of course happen upon their grandparents,uncles, aunties and cousins in a single day.Such closeness has its advantages & disadvantages,but generally the young people must enjoy it,as few people want to leave when they grow up.{LANGUAGE,}We could not find one fluent speaker of Cornish,but despite this,many Cornish words are familiar as they occur in place names and surnames e.g. Bodinnick,Tolgarrick, Tregargus,Trelion and Tresweeta.
